title: Will the closing price of Facebook stock be higher on 5 August 2020 than it was on 7 July 2020?
preds: High chance as on July 7 it was $240.86 vs today 247.82
less than a 1% chance of not being higher
High chance as on July 7 it was $240.86 vs today 251.96
Unlikely to drop 4.5% in two days.
Two days and it'd have to drop 4% . Seems like that won't happen
Well I certainly blew this one. Maybe next time.
Facebook reported ad revenue growth despite the coronavirus.
Trending higher in these last few weeks. Noise from Facebook boycott subsiding and appears to have been the less spoken about representative at the congressional inquiry.
High chance as on July 7 it was $240.86 vs today 253.67
July 31 increase was the largest in the past month, indicating investors confidence in the company after recent earning's reports despite the controversies currently surrounding the platform itself.

I guess markets will have a losing week before resolution of this question with abundant reasons, the latest of which is tropical storm "Isaias", which could strengthen again and organize into a hurricane, and now threatens to affect the entire East coast of the USA.
Although the facebook stock has de-coupled from Nasdaq 100 and has thus become an alpha trade over the last few days, earnings and news tend to be traded on only as long as they are rumors, and tend to stop doing so when they're facts.
I struggle to interpret the news on tiktok with regards to facebook's future, but when you look at it closely, the risk of espionage on personal data (especially when they get lost by the company) is not so much different from the one in facebook's data pile, so recommendations of the pentagon may also apply to facebook and their lax data handling. Combining this with the repeated congressional hearings, it seems to me that "nationalizing the data stock" could to be a target of national security authorities in the US with the "National Security interest" as a reason, in which a significantly lower prize and finally a buy-out could be the result. facebook already acts like a governmental body in times (e.g. supporting "predicitve policing"), so why not be a national agency openly in the future? To me it seems, the process has already started in 2020.

Current prize: 253.67, 3 Business days left. No corresponds to a decline of at least 5%. Base rate for this over the last 10 years: 6.25%.
As the crowd is at 91% for yes, I round up to 7%. So 93% for yes.
253 now. Three trading days to drop 4.7% is quite a lot given the recent boost from earnings. If there isn't any major facebook news or any great shift in the market it'll beat the $241 mark I think
Looks like with TikTok in imminent danger of being barred in the US, the market has decided that devotees of That Sort Of Thing are stuck with Zuck a bit longer. Or maybe not.
Barring a major meltdown in the next week Facebook’s stock will be higher than it was on July 7.
Big jump over the last day.
Big jump as of today and that leaves only a couple more trading days. Barring a huge drop in the market overall, this looks much more likely than it did a week ago
Surpassing even my initial hunch: https://www.gjopen.com/comments/1084233
still very volatile but tech sector earnings will likely carry until August 5th

FB likely to have positive momentum after earnings release, however, there is not much other good news to drive the overall market higher.
Doubtful to reach it's July 7 number in the timeframe given. I mean give me one other piece of good news.
The words 'monopolistic behaviour' at a senate hearing won't help with investor confidence.
Going up a little bit over unexpected earnings report.
Outcome of earnings paired with previous discussion. Possible negative sentiment from anti-trust, further ad-protesr or just a random walk down possible but unlikely to overwhelm earnings beat.
Beat estimates by a huge margin.
FB up in AH trading on earnings beat.  Flipping from unlikely to very likely.

Price on 7/7: 240.86
Price today 7/30: 234.08
Change implied by question: 2.89%
Annualized implied vol = 40%, weekly == 5.5%
So ~85% of the time you'd expect a move of <+5.5%... using a Z score table, if this is a 0.5 Z move, you get about  30%

- Estimates have been consistently beaten this week (508 positive to 129 negative or 80% positive).
-  High probability of announcing steps to address boycott. Probably will assuage some fears weighing on stock. (Call it 80% and 60% for 48%)
- Twitter had a surprise user increase, which could make for positive sentiment (70% / 30% for 21%)
- As previously discussed by others, recent price movement makes a random rebound very unlikely (2%)

2 out of 4 should put the price back above 240.86. One negative opposite would probably cancel that out.

Analyzing 4-day returns over the period from the start of 2020 and assuming that the distribution of the returns will be the same over the next 4 days will be the same we get this probability. We can get another POV by assuming the stock price follows the GBM and try to obtain the distribution that way - this, however, results in 0% probability for the event happening (unless the implied volatility is incredibly high).
I'm ok with being bullish on this one.
Earnings report probably won't have great news and the price is already several percent lower than it was on July 7th.

Analyzing 5-day returns over the period from the start of 2020 and assuming that the distribution of the returns will be the same over the next 5 days will be the same we get this probability. We can get another POV by assuming the stock price follows the GBM and try to obtain the distribution that way - this, however, results in 0% probability for the event happening (unless the implied volatility is incredibly high).

FB is at a great price right now. I'm not confident where we'll be on the 5th one way or the other, but people who do this for a living don't care about boycotts or hearings when a product doesn't have a replacement on the market.

Anti trust hearing coming up July 29.

July 27=233.52USD on a good day for the Nasdaq FB up qual to the market. 2 days before earnings.
Should have stuck with my original assessment.
That would correspond to a 4.4% increase in 8 business days. Base rate for that is 15.5%. Crowd is currently at 40%. Corrected forecast: 17%

The closing price has been higher than 240.86 50% of the trading days since the 7th as I write. However, the stock is in a short downtrend along with other NASDAQ megacaps and I expect continued weakness by that group at least through then next 2 weeks. Therefore, I anticipate a substantially lower chance of seeing the 7th closing price surpassed as compared with recent history.
It's been trending down, so at least some decline seems more likely.

Challenges related to short-term stock predictions are great for learning about investing.  They teach humility.  In the future I should do one of two things: don't make a prediction, or set my prediction to 50%.
Market just dropped a lot, after staying roughly constant for a while.

Mr. Market has woke to reality.
July 24=229.71USD

July 7th price was 240.86 [1]. Close today was 232.60, despite the bull market over the last few weeks. It appears that ad buys are dropping due to boycotts [1]. This seems likely to continue, or at least impact facebooks stock for the next few weeks. A quick turn around could be possible if they do some drastic moves regarding how they deal with political ads. [1] https://www.benzinga.com/news/earnings/20/07/16745524/facebook-ad-boycott-to-continue-publicis-predicts-as-organic-revenue-drops-13-in-q2
Having a bad run over the last 7 days.

7 July = $240.86.
23 July = 231.99USD on a down market day.
Has Mr. Market grown cold toward megaTech stocks that are loosing advertizers or is this just a consoldation before racing to the moon?

July 20 close = 245.42USD up 3% in a strong market rally based on HOPE.  The target is $240.86
July 21 = 241.75USD in a NASDAQ the is drifing lower.
Hattip @kfinsnes for a well reasoned analysis and backup for the forecast. For me I just put a wet finger in the wind and spun the dial.

FB stock closed at $240.86 on July 7. Today, FB closed at $245.42. There are 12 remaining trading days before August 5th. Given expected daily volatility of 1-2%, a base rate of 60% can be assumed, implying that FB is roughly equally likely to increase or decrease in value before the 5th of August. Our final prediction shouldn’t stray too far from this value either, as markets are generally efficient, and I am by no means an expert in FB stock. There are a few important events to highlight that will strongly influence Facebook stock. On 7/29, after market close, FB will release earnings. EPS expectations are lower that any of the past four quarters, due to new headwinds facing adverting revenues. The company has been subject to an advertiser boycott due to the not policing the veracity of content on the platform more closely, and not removing hate speech. Earnings will likely have a large impact on whether or not the stock price is up or down on the time interval considered.  Currently, we are in the midst of earnings season. Twitter reports earnings on 7/23. Snap reports on 7/21. Apple and Amazon report on 7/30. These are all events that could affect the stock price of FB, positively or negative depending on if industry trends are elucidated.  Finally, the federal reserve will report Q2 GDP figures on 7/30. This is likely to have a large impact on all equities. The median forecast is currently -31% (according to marketwatch) compared to the same quarter last year. This will potentially depress stocks further as retail investors respond to this news. Assuming a binomial pricing model, and daily volatility of 1.5%, in 2510/4096 (61%) cases the price of FB stock is above 240.86 by 8/5. The 8/7 245 straddle is trading at $23.10, (this accounts for 14 trading days, not 12). A fine estimate is that the straddle at the current stock price for expiry on 8/5 would be trading at about $20. (In 50% of cases, the stock price would remain within $20 from the stock price). This is roughly consistent with our 61% estimate using a binomial distribution.

July 20 close = 245.42USD up 3% in a strong market rally based on HOPE. So today we are over 2% higher than the target. Short term, assuming HOPE continues as the driving force and that Q2 numbers don't dramatically drop, it should stay above the target.

Based on current share price and bull market i would suggest yes - I would have thought the BLM reaction and  brands leaving would have made a difference but its back where it was before. https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/facebook-shares-react-badly-ad-boycott-big-stock-moves-2020-7-1029365957#
Why? Zuckerberg’s joint town hall on FB with Dr Fauci will win FB some support.

Pretty much a wash so far. I assume that in the absence of big news or a surprise on the earnings released 29 July it may just depend on what the market as a whole does. Big earnings news would make this a lot easier!
At time it would appear to be on the bubble. Who knew?
$240 was practically the highest price ever.  I think it will return above, but not in this timeframe.
Tough one in a volatile market. Covid should still be a mess. Politics of division rampant. Ongoing criticism of FB. I will track which way it is going for a few more days before moving on this.

Earning estimate is about 1.37 a share (not dividend). Last quarter was 1.71. It will be reported on 7/29/20. The effect could be that it is still earning money while many industries are in the negative. Yet it is already trading at close to all time high. Conclusion? A short boost in price that hopefully makes it to August 5.
Tech has been on a huge upswing. Elections will help. The boycott was mainly because of large companies - FB relies on smaller (SME) for the majority of their advertising revenue.
July 13 = 239.00USD along with the rest of the NASDAQ. Could this be the start of a small correction, or just a knee jerk dip soon to be papered over by Robinhood traders?

Prior: 66% by calculating historical earnings returns Reasons for higher:
1. people flood to mega-cap during times of uncertainties
2. elections coming up, social media platforms getting more important
3. has a history of beating consensus on earnings Reasons for lower:
1. ad revenue decreases over social controversies, though likely small
2. most upsides already priced in, possible market re calibration coming up
Presuming fb stock doesn't drop below $227 between now and then, I'd call this just shy of a safe bet.
Read an article that said it is still a growth stock.
People have moved on from BLM and ads should return as the economy returns to normalcy.

The pullout of advertisers will not generally spook investors, who know that people log in to Facebook for reasons utterly unconnected with ethical issues.   Zuckerberg is skilled at talking FB out of trouble, and users seem to want to believe him if he assures them his product is safe.  In other words, bad things don't stick to FB, and advertisers will return, shyly at first, but inevitably to a hyperactive marketplace.  Investors know this.

On Jul. 10th, Facebook closed at 245.07, higher than Jul.7th and a step away from its historical high. Though the bad news of advertiser boycott made FB stock drop sharply initially, it quickly regained its territory and broke its previous high. Therefore I won’t be worrying too much on the negative impact brought by advertiser boycott as market has already priced in that component. Assume stock follows a Geometric Brownian Motion, since right now the stock price is a bit higher than the reference price, and interest rate right now is pretty close to 0, I will assign a base rate of 55%.  The major driver for Facebook stock is COVID-19. As daily new cases continuously achieve daily record, and with fed providing enough liquidity to prevent systematic failure, tech companies like Facebook/Google/Amazon benefit greatly. Right now, I believe it is similar to April/May 2020, where value of technology companies was gradually discovered by the market.  Factors that can bring down the price may include bad earning news for the company, scandals, systematic liquidity issues, etc. However, most of these risks have been handled (e.g. systematic liquidity by FED) or absorbed by the market. Therefore, I would adjust my prior more towards the up side and give a forecast of 65%

Any threat to Facebook is from regulatory risk, not anybody's revulsion at bad behaviour.  Additional regulation, probably from Europe, that would significantly affect the stock won't hit before this deadline.  Meantime, the punters just keep on coming.
FB has just built a cushion into it's price, likelyhood of a down draft is lessened.

tech and "FAMANG" leadership seem likely to persist in near-term, given FB higher odds than typical stock of being "up" vs. overall market.  Odds of pullback that overwhelm this dynamic are reasonable, so slight better than coin-flip odds.

Crowded trade in FANG/ NASDAQ stocks, seems to shrug off bad news (COVID, political, etc). There's a big divergence in S&P and S&P ex-tech stocks. As long as Fed continues to support the market, investors will continue to pile into stock which are perceived safer and has more momentum (which is tech in this environment)

Facebook has agreed to police content on it's site. The Fed is still buying assets including corporate stock. The FED is committed to keeping the stock market up.  FANG stocks in particular have been riding more than other stocks.

Facebook has reached its maturity in terms of subscribers and with revenues primarily kicking in from advertising it cannot be divorced from the pain in the economy in the medium term plus with advertisers taking a stance on FB it should start showing up in the stock price underperforming

The company is under pressure from advertizers and employees for current policies. Advertizers are the providers of cash not employees or users. I don't know the extent of the advertizers pullout, but overtime could be detremental to the bottom line. My assumption is that there will be some impact to Q2 results. When a growth stock stops growing it can be reflected in the stock price. July 8 it closed at what looks like all time high at 243.58 and went higher after hours. Earlier this week it went above 247. Will 4 weeks show a dramatic turn-around and investor flight? Long term prospects are good, but are it's followers buy and hold types or momentum chasers? I've been expecting another market pullback for months and am still waiting. Will 4 weeks make a difference? Wish I knew. P/E = 34+

@SE_Meyer has given a good explanation of why the Facebook stock could be under pressure over the next 30 days - though I feel the 0% forecast is a bit too aggressive.  Some of the other factors that I would like to point out
- FB stock trading around an All Time High (and near a nice round figure of USD 250). This would suggest some sort of consolidation before breaking upwards.
- Q2 will be a bad quarter for FB (both from an advertiser quantity and quality). The release of these numbers would also put pressure on the stock
- The impact of Q2 earnings (in general) would put pressure on the Indices and lead to pressure on FB (since it is a high beta stock) So baseline estimates are 20% for a Yes. Will follow and revise as needed.

With individuals taking on 'activist' stances on every side of the aisle, Facebook is going to have trouble finding a 'winning' position.  Whatever FB does won't be enough for either side and will generate criticism.  Easier to save advertising expense by not taking a risk in that ad pool.  Add to that privacy concerns raised by TikTok that will be covered in the media and inevitably renew the concerns about other social media privacy.  Finally, people are 'out-and-about' this summer, concerned that fall might bring more shut-in time, so there will be less social media activity than there was this spring
Forecasting the stock market, or any one individual stock, in the short term is difficult at best.  But there is a saying that "the trend is your friend."  And the trend has been up.
Will be unaffected by boycotts. Growth has been consistent since COVID crash.
It may increase but not dramatically. Last 3 months has increased 42.34%  and last month only 6.43%.

I think it is more of a beta-question here (30-d beta is around 1.4 towards Nasdaq), which suggest the stock is rather sensitive to respective changes in the index.
facebook is a powerful, influential, efficient and by and large unregulated, ugly and malign cash machine monster, nevertheless they fell by more than 30 per cent in spring 2020 due to the pandemic uncertainty (their business model is long lightheartedness and labor income). The stock recovered quickly and overcompensated for previous losses due to a unique position and financial strength. As stocks in general are currently "ambitiously priced" to say the least considering political markets ahead of US presidential elections and economic reality, the Nasdaq100 is likely to fall over the next month. High beta means facebook is likely to exaggerate the drop and will fall even more. I guess the stock is going to have a "double- to triple top" on all-time-high around 250USD before the stock's long lasting trend will finally break, I'm not sure, however, if this is happening during the month proposed in the question.
As some of the recent troubles with business and advertisement partners will grow and awareness of the dangers that an unregulated facebook poses to societies and democracy (and the damage it has already done in the past) among those in charge will rise , headwinds for facebook are going to get rougher, and the company is likely not going to pay any dividend anyway. So things are never going to be the same, easy cakewalk for Big Data and social platforms again, competition watchdogs as well as politicians will be forced to have a closer eye on Mr Zuckerbergs Money Bin, it will be tougher for facebook to aggregate and centralize peoples' online lives by simply buying every promising start-up that was thought as an alternative to facebook, and democracies can no longer afford  facebook's outlets to distract everybody from urgent real world problems that need to be solved or to manipulate the political process in their own best interest. Maybe, as a good side-effect of the pandemic, people will realize how uninteresting and shallow their lives on Instagram used to be, and how lukewarm the word friend has become, after facebook monopolized it. The bad thing: facebook already knows you better than you yourself, which makes everybody susceptible to blackmail, even those decision makers. And policing without facebook's APIs is hard to imagine nowadays. Strong sell, in the long term - a breakup is more a matter of how and when, than if, imho.

Currently slightly higher than this price as of time of this writing. My long-term view on fundamentals and stock price is positive for FB, Short-term stock movements are inherently unpredictable, so no high degree of confidence around movement either wa
Recent cleaning by FB will not make advertisers content. Much more to be done by them.
Facebook is now experiencing negative publicity which will lower the price, but by August the price will rebound as investors come around to the importance of Facebook in the pandemic.

It is trading at close to its high for the last 52 weeks. Chances are in this climate not going higher. Embroiled in controversy might hurt it some. Have to wonder if advertising will be curtailed due to many people laid off and corporate bankruptcies? Less money for people to spend. Covid cases are climbing but lockdown would probably help not hurt FB.

While there was an initial shock to the boycott with the stock price dipping, it has already recovered from that and the price is moving upward again.  Ad revenue is not tied to stock price. Large companies make up a relatively small percentage of Facebook’s ad revenue, while small to medium businesses make up the rest.  Most small to medium sized businesses are less concerned with social issues and will likely continue advertising with Facebook.  All in all, I see the stock price for Facebook continuing its upward trend.
